website_summaries.verdict: Super soft and lightweight, this popular pet carrier makes it easy and cost-effective to plan a cross-country or international flight with your furry friend.
pros: Extra-wide padded shoulder strap, waterproof nylon shell, and a durable construction that resists chewing
Hook and loop strips on bottom help secure carrier to rugs so there's no sliding around
Short strap and clip inside that latches to collar for more security
cons: Some consumers feel that the floor of the carrier could be made of harder material
Will only be comfortable for smaller cats and dogs

customer_reviews.title: My cat is probably a murderer
customer_reviews.text: Well, this carrier would have been fine, but my cat is a murderer. Put her in this for maybe 20 min max and the teeny tiny hole she nibbled in the outer mesh suddenly became an epic escape route that she was able to squeeze her whole fluffy body through. The carrier also happens to be a little small for my 10 lbs cat. In its defense, I did take a swatch of the mesh to Petco and compared it to other $45-70 fabric carriers, and it was the exact same material. The carrier is made of quality materials, but it still gets 3 stars because it couldn't contain my floof-monster (who now has a plastic carrier with bars).
customer_reviews.author: Gwynneth

customer_reviews.title: Cat escaped from carrier on plane, once by pushing on zippers and again by making a hole in the mesh.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this so my cat, who is about 10 pounds, could travel with me via air with the carrier placed under the seat in front me. I used this carrier for one round trip flight in October without incident. I used it again in January -- the cat escaped by separating the zippers and got all the way to first class from the waaaay back of the plane before a flight attendant caught her. On the return trip, she got out again, this time via a rip she'd made in the mesh, but I was able to catch her after she'd only gotten about five aisles away. I'll be purchasing a new carrier before I travel with her again.
customer_reviews.author: nxp

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it... very well made. Very easy to get my cat in and out of. the cat in the picture is a 22lb. cat, or was last time he was weighed.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Cats survive coast to coast travel in comfort.
customer_reviews.text: We had a very traumatic trip scheduled last month......flying from the west coast to the east coast with two cats to our new home, with a layover in Atlanta. Each cat had their own Pet Travel carrier and first class under seat floor space. The trip wasn't 100% smooth, but the pet carriers were the best allowing "the girls" to rock and complain at will! They were light weight enough to prop on our laps in an effort to calm them. One cat liked her carrier so much that she continues to seek it out as her choice for nap location.
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Torres

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Carrier
customer_reviews.text: I took my 16.7 lb Maine Coon mix to the vet in this awesome looking carrier today. It was super easy to load him in the carrier and it was quite easy to carry the carrier with the handle and shoulder strap in place. Kitty seemed to be able to turn around in the carrier quite easily despite his husky size. He seemed comfy. I have only used it once, but it seems quite sturdy. I also like that your pet has multiple windows to see out of. All in all, this will suit my needs to transport kitty to the vet when needed.
customer_reviews.author: JazzyRNLisa

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't recommend unless you're a pro at getting kitties into tight
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend unless you're a pro at getting kitties into tight, dark and flimsy spaces, which I am not. As a first time cat mom, I needed something simple and reliable. I recommend the Sport Pet triangular carrier, instead. It's collapsible and the front door makes it easy for even a newbie to safely and calmly get her cat inside and secured. Fits perfectly in my front seat and within its seatbelts, too.
customer_reviews.author: queuey

customer_reviews.title: Cat tore thru mesh not safe
customer_reviews.text: Bought to travel, cat ripped through the front mesh net and injured his nose. I was supposed to take a flight at 7that morning. I would never buy this product again. The second one I purchased the cat pee is really hard to remove so I literally bought these and they both got thrown out with one use and one with none
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve M. Valentine

customer_reviews.title: Great little dog carrier
customer_reviews.text: My dog is 12 lbs but he is very tall/big and he fit nicely laying down. I am very happy with this bag because it is very sturdy and also because it doesn't have too many mesh windows. I wanted my dog to have limited visibility so he would stay calm however he did get a little hot before the cabin in the airplane cooled down. I found a pad that fit perfectly to provide more cushioning, I didn't want to use a towel or something else that would get bunched up as he moved around. The pad I used was this one
customer_reviews.author: flygirllauraTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Useful
customer_reviews.text: The carrier was a little smaller than I had anticipated, but my cat is 12+ lbs. I should say was, because as it turned out I had to put my cat down at the vets the day I used it. This was in NO WAY the fault of the carrier however? My cat was almost 14 and had been declining in health. I am just so sad and I shouldn't be talking about it here, but...I'm sorry. The carrier was lightweight and the shoulder strap was very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine Moran

customer_reviews.title: Update: not made well anymore
customer_reviews.text: Great cat carrier! Definitely better than a hard case with a handle, especially for transporting my 16 lb cat. Update: I bought this a couple years ago and it was great. The new one I just bought is inferior... Cheaper materials and construction. The original one holds it's shape with my 16 lb cat, while this new one loses it's shape with my 10 lb cat. The strap is made of cheaper materials and sewn in a less durable fashion. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: jayme

customer_reviews.title: Sure worked for this1st time air traveler!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is THE ONE! A loved one transitioned, had to travel for an extended time during Christmas and didnt wanna leave my kitty. In trying to get him used to the carrier, (first time!), he clawed and pressed his body against the sides trying to escape, even bloodied his own nose, but it HELD!! Found some hemp oil for cats and pheromone spray to help keep him calm, which did wonders. I enjoyed having his leash attachable on the inside, storage pocket on the outside as well. For a first-time, stressed, grieving pet traveler, I am grateful I had this durable pet carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Momma Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Cat loves it, and i do too!
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard plastic carrier before i got this one, and my cat hated it. He would yowl and complain and do everything to get out of it. But he actually likes this carrier! He's happy to stay inside where ever we go, but he prefers to sit on me when we're at home. He goes in easy, and purrs the whole car ride now. Its easy to assemble, just a few zippers. And it has a handy pocket in the back that i keep his vet book in!
customer_reviews.author: bubbles

customer_reviews.title: very sturdy and easy to carry for short trips
customer_reviews.text: I was searching for a long trip carrier for my 10-pound cat, but kept this one anyway, for short trips, because it's compact design is easy for my 5'3" frame to carry. It's also very sturdy, so great for trips by car or public transportation to the vet. But too small for more than a 20 minute ride, not for an airline flight. She could not lay down in kitty sprawl, but only in kitty crouch and could not stand up nor turn around easily. I think it would work well for a kitten or a Yorkie or similar size pet.
customer_reviews.author: Cornichon

customer_reviews.title: Overall good buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall the bag is a great buy! My tall/long cat fit fine in there and could move around to look at either side of the carrier. Whenever he’d flip it shook the carrier being that it’s very light, so make sure your pet/carrier is on a stable surface. Took the cat on the plane but it didn’t fit really under the seat, but no one gave me any issues. I didn’t notice this initially, but it has velcro on the bottom so it doesn’t slip around too! The cat and carrier weighed about 17lbs on my shoulder and the little padding on the strap didn’t help. Consider getting or sewing extra padding for that.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this carrier!
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cute carrier, manageable to carry. We have a 5 month old kitten and I don't anticipate she'll get really big, but this is a smaller carrier so if she does we may have to get something different. But she was cozy and had room to move (not that she chose to use it) on the way to the vet today. I actually think the fact that she can't slide around in the car is probably comforting for her. She can see out the screen "windows" all around, and we can easily access her. I like that the carrier has a pocket and that it folds flat for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal5

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, Easy to Clean, Easy to store
customer_reviews.text: I got this because my cat has extreme anxiety when put in any carrier or cat. He immediately pees or poops. I have a bigger more expensive backpack but got tired of constantly cleaning it. Also, it takes up a lot of room while storing. This bag breaks down and is waterproof. I like how easy it was to clean when the inevitable happened and easy to fold and store. The only negative is it did get wet on the bottom and leaked out the sides a little when my cat peed in it. Next time I’ll make sure a thick towel is inside it. Overall I’m happy.
customer_reviews.author: Lyss

customer_reviews.title: Help together with one zipper!
customer_reviews.text: I do not like the fact that this carrier had only one zipper. It is held together by one zipper. There is no way I will put my dog in this carrier. The zipper does not lock, so when you open the carrier to take out the dog, the entire carrier can unzip. I have never seen such a design.
customer_reviews.author: B. V. Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Works great but get the bigger size
customer_reviews.text: My cat was a little crammed in this one as it was smaller than I expected (my cat is 12 lbs). I got it to fly her from CT to IL. She had a sedative so that helped her. Also I kept a light cover over the little windows so she didn't see everything around her. It fit perfectly under the seat in front of me and I'm sure a larger one would have too since they are soft and so can conform to the space. The shoulder strap helped as carrying her through the airport got tiresome.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy R. Sirvatka

customer_reviews.title: Oh the smell!
customer_reviews.text: This carrier appears to be well made, and has a nice look. I just adopted a cat last week. She is less than seven pounds. This carrier is just the right size for her, but seems small for any larger cat. My one big issue is the smell. My cat went in one time and hasn't been back since. I've tried a few methods to eliminate the smell; put it outside, stuffed it with newspaper (works on so many things). Neither worked. I'll be taking her for her first vet appointment in three days and don't want to force her to sit inside this carrier with the odor. I'll update if I find a method that works.
customer_reviews.author: Theresa

customer_reviews.title: Not sure a cat will find it comfortable
customer_reviews.text: We just received this today for the kitten we're getting this week. The chemical smell out of the package almost knocked me over! It's outside airing out not, but I can't imagine it'll be too pleasant to a sensitive kitten nose. It also has almost no padding on the floor and no removable, washable pad. It seems sturdy and is a little bigger than I thought it would be. I also like that it unzips all the way so you can get a cat out from the top and collapse it for storage. I want to return it, but I don't think I'll be able to find something else in time, so I may have to keep it.
customer_reviews.author: jane m

customer_reviews.title: Not escape proof
customer_reviews.text: Fair warning, if your cat is able to unzip it even a little bit, the entire thing will unzip and cat is free. Things I learned while driving down the road with a cat that was having a mental break. One trip to the ER, a thorough cleaning of angry cat mess from the car, and possibly future therapy (both for myself, my children, and the cat), it all worked out okay. The cat freaked and peed in it, and that smell isn't going away, so after one trip, it's in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: dianne p.

customer_reviews.title: Great product but remove velcro from the bottom of it.
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It was very easy to travel with three cats (one cat per carrier) on a plane. Don't place your pets in the cargo compartment - it's quite easy to take them in the passenger space with you and place under the front seat. I gave 4 stars instead of 5 only because one little blunder - they have a strip of velcro right outside of the bottom - and it sticks to the carpet on the floor of an airplace. Initially I wasn't able to understand - why wouldn't it move under the seat and then I couldn't pull it out. Then I saw this velcro and was able to move it in and out easier.
customer_reviews.author: Mikhail Gavryuchkov

customer_reviews.title: Fine for short trips
customer_reviews.text: This is a decently constructed carrier, the right size for an average-sized cat. Mine is a chonky 10-lb boy and fits with plenty of room. I wish the bottom of it had a little more cushion, but it works fine for short car rides. Has a long adjustable strap and a handle. However, the zipper is not as sturdy as I’d like; my cat was able to get the carrier open enough to escape within five minutes of being inside. Granted, he’s a bit of an escape artist, but this isn’t ideal. I’d prefer it had a sturdier zipper so I didn’t have to twisty-tie it closed to keep him inside.
customer_reviews.author: KCS

customer_reviews.title: Product not as shown!
customer_reviews.text: I love the orange version of this carrier, which is why I got a second one in blue. Unfortunately, I just realized the blue one has plastic hardware instead of stainless steel like the orange one, which is very disappointing. The last thing I need is for something to snap while I'm running through the airport with two cats. It's too late to return it and I have to fly with them 4/30. I have to lower the rating for false advertising, as the blue one in the product images and video *does* have stainless steel hardware. Otherwise, it's a great carrier, I just don't trust it.
customer_reviews.author: Erin B. Morrigan

customer_reviews.title: Unaligned zip, small soft bag
customer_reviews.text: Didn't zip properly, as if not aligned. Concept is nice for space saving. Ordered a large for a almost 4 lb cat, the dimensions didnt match and no way kitty would have fit in this. More for a small kitten or teacup pup. Soft like a backpack so wouldn't use for travel. Expected something a bit more sturdy like a sports bag at least. Perhaps they sent me the wrong size considering pics of fairly large cats. :( TL:DR Not sturdy, very small for tiny tiny pet, zip didn't work well. Good space saving concept.
customer_reviews.author: Name

customer_reviews.title: Small Pet Travel Carrier
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter's Toy Poodle to travel on vacation this summer. The flight was a direct 3.5 hour flight. The carrier is roomy and her 4-pound puppy was quite comfortable. I would not put any animal over 8 pounds in this carrier because I do not think there would be enough room to turn or stand. The bottom has Velcro which adheres to the rug on the plan and stays put on take off and descent. The dark material and mesh windows provides a soothing environment and fosters napping for any anxious pet during travel.
customer_reviews.author: mamaJ

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this case after looking at local pet stores for something to fly with our cat in. We needed something soft and airline approved for the cabin but durable, comfortable and safe. I did not want to spend $50-$60 and this was the best solution we found. For the price I figured we would order early and see how it was. I am super impressed. This is a durable travel kennel. Just as good as the super expensive ones we checked out in stores and I love the blue color over the brown and blacks we kept seeing. This zips up sturdy but can fold nice and flat for storage. Really happy with it! Great value.
customer_reviews.author: Leanne

customer_reviews.title: LARGE CATS BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: Too small for any cat except a kitten or very small adult. Don’t believe the description on size of cat! But very easy to carry & airline approved. Gave it away because my 3 year old petite kittie had trouble turning around & was too short for her. Terrible experience. Originally bought it for my short 10 pounder due to description. Just say’in...
customer_reviews.author: Adrie33

customer_reviews.title: 2 Different Cats Escaped
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. The zipper does NOT hold. It worked ok at first, then my cat ripped it open from inside like when a zipper detaches on a coat. Just used this carrier again today for another cat and he nosed the zipper open and escaped.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Hill

customer_reviews.title: I love that it folds flat(ish) to keep in a closet ...
customer_reviews.text: Really impressed with this carrier. I love that it folds flat(ish) to keep in a closet when not in use. We flew on Southwest and the carrier was okay and fit easily under the seat. The only semi-annoying thing is that there is velcro on the bottom to prevent the carrier from sliding around and that made getting the carrier under the seat kind of a challenge. My dog did great in the carrier. He's 10lbs, a larger sized long hair chihuahua and was able to turn around and everything.
customer_reviews.author: ACW

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!!
customer_reviews.text: My 7lb. tiny cat became overheated and tried to claw her way out of this carrier while in an air conditioned vehicle. Thank God she was right next to me on the seat or she would have died.
customer_reviews.author: cathy diehl

customer_reviews.title: Pleasing Apperance.
customer_reviews.text: I get so many complements with this bag. The orange color is simply amazing. It kept my pet secured and safe when traveling. The material is just right, I thought it was going to be soft, but it was tougher than it looks which provides my cat with security. I did not like the strap however, it could of been better with a nicer padding to prevent my shoulders from hurting. Overall, the product is just right! Your pet can easily breathe and traveling is made simple without the bulky hard carriers.
customer_reviews.author: Lee Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and nice looking, but could use some added sturdiness.
customer_reviews.text: I have never purchased a cat carrier before, and this is very convenient and easy to clean but I would probably purchase a hard plastic one instead if I needed to buy again. I think my cat was a little uncomfortable when she was being carried because the bottom is material and not rock hard so it did sag in the middle with her weight, which I think made her more nervous than she would have been otherwise. Affordable and nice looking, but could use some added sturdiness.
customer_reviews.author: Chloe

customer_reviews.title: Light weight
customer_reviews.text: First thing my new kitty did after we opened and put it together was go right in and fall asleep in it. Very nicely made. Sturdy. Light weight enough to carry on your shoulder. As we get older, we find those big bulky pet cases are hard to carry. This really does make it much easier and my kitty is happy in it. Nice blue color. Great quality seat belt "like" nylon strap handle and over the shoulder. Plus it folders down flat for easy storage. Good value.
customer_reviews.author: geri 74

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Works really well for my cat. The only issue I had was when the zippers were on the end, my cat was able to push his way through and get out. When the zippers are together on the bottom he was not able to open the carrier. I recommend doing this or use something to tie the zippers together. Other than that the carrier is awesome and works great.
customer_reviews.author: nichole

customer_reviews.title: Scaredy Cat no more
customer_reviews.text: My cat is a rescue cat that we have had now for 9 years and he is petrified of going outdoors. We are moving this weekend and so we did a trial run in this carrier to the vet to potentially get sedation for him for the move, but after about 5 minutes of meowing loudly, he settled right down. I chose to not get sedation for him as I think he will be just fine. I love the mesh sides so he can stare at me as I am driving with those pathetic eyes but the sides are close enough for my big fat 19.5 lb cat to feel comfortable and secure. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: mtkimberly

customer_reviews.title: poorly made, looks better than it is (which is bad)
customer_reviews.text: 1.5 We were lured to this by the rave reviews and the fact that it is light and [it seems] specific for travels. But it's really terrible, and we ended up throwing it out. The zippers get stuck a lot, and are not easy to close up, so if you have a fussy cat, it will get away. Plus, it lays funny. It is not well made, it's cheap. Decent strap that, fortunately, fits other carriers.
customer_reviews.author: RachelM

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this carrier to bring a new puppy home on a flight. I prefer the structure of this bag to the more collapsible variety. It did squish down an inch or two to fit under the plane seat, but it doesn't totally collapse in on the puppy. It maintains its shape. The pocket on the back was also nice. I was able to fill it with pee pads, poop bags, wet wipes, leash, a baggie of food and toys for the trip home. Plus, the orange color is super cute!
customer_reviews.author: grittyagility

customer_reviews.title: ehhh
customer_reviews.text: This serve my immediate need for a quick run to the vet, but that is about it. would not use for long travel trips. Certainly not on a plan. the zipper came bent outward and had to be worked to get it zip closed, the shoulder strap is not to be trusted at all and makes no sense as it is attached on one end to the inside of the case. The clips holding the straps on are weak. The Only plus is that is can fold down pretty flat for storage. so be wary
customer_reviews.author: Cynd

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy!!!
customer_reviews.text: This item does NOT securely contain a pet. The mesh is not sturdy (my cat tore right through it). It is cheaply made and worthless for transporting a cat. Returning item,
customer_reviews.author: genia2433

customer_reviews.title: I've just purchased this again!
customer_reviews.text: That should tell you how pleased I have been with this brand and style. I now have a smaller orange one I have taken on Delta numerous times, and the new larger blue carrier. There's a strong dye smell when you first unpack it, but that fades once you have assembled it and let it air out a bit. When I pick up my car keys, my dog bolts into the carrier and waits for me to zip it up, so suffice it to say, my 5 lb Chihuahua likes it too!
customer_reviews.author: Jordy

customer_reviews.title: Good for a small kitty!
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a soft-sided carrier to take my kitty to the vet thinking it would be easier to carry and a bit more stylish than the hard crate I had. This was very easy to sip together and the kitty actually likes it. I leave it out and he lays in it. I would note that he's a small to average sized kitty (almost 8 pounds), and I'm glad I got the large size.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hansen

customer_reviews.title: The vet could slam a needle THROUGH the carrier.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for scardy cats. They felt super secure and I could schlep them around on each shoulder and they could listen to each other scream. It was fun. Super lightweight and easy to carry. The vet was able to slam a needle THROUGH THE CARRIER since my cats decided to not come out. Airline safe too. My cats will be in these for a 17 hour flight to Australia so I will update how that whole ordeal goes. For now, the vet was productive.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin786

customer_reviews.title: I love it, the cat loves it too
customer_reviews.text: I've always hated using the plastic cat carriers because they're so rigid and usually difficult to work with. My sweet cat is a rescue with a LOT of anxiety, so with our first trip to the vet, I wanted DiNozzo to be as comfortable as possible, and I ordered this soft carrier. I love it, and more importantly, my cat loves it. Was super easy to get him into and out of, even by myself. I don't quite understand it but DiNozzo's favorite place to nap and relax is in this carrier. I tried to put it away and he was not happy, so it stays out and he naps in it daily. So glad that I got this carrier!
customer_reviews.author: Erica Rose

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I adopted a shelter cat last year. Because of the soft bottom, I was able to hold her in her carrier on my lap while my husband drove. I think it was comforting to her to feel a person there & she seemed very content. I love the way it's made to unzip all around. I love that there's pockets on the side for treats or wipes. She had no urinary accident in it, but great knowing it's waterproof. SO well made!
customer_reviews.author: southerngal

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for critters and your budget.
customer_reviews.text: Actually purchased to transport a Bearded Dragon. Is larger than expected, with great padding. Took a minute to figure out how it went from folded to pet ready. Just keep zipping! Shoulder strap is great, love the eye catching orange color. Plenty of room for my beardies favorite blanket a pillow. I'm sure I like it more than he does, but I was very happy not to have a freaked-out 'exploding' reptile wanting to escape a big bad scary. He went in with no problems, seemed very calm & comfortable for the whole time we were traveling. The price and quality were perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great, but could use a 2-way separating zipper for opening both ends at once.
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is great. The only complaint I'd have about it is the zipper has a single pull, meaning you can only open one end of it without unzipping the entire thing and once it's unzipped completely it is not stable enough to stand open on it's own (which is great for folding and storing though!). My cats enjoy playing in it, but it would be great if both ends were open so they could "tunnel" through it. Beyond that though, it's very well constructed and sturdy enough for carrying even our larger cat to the vet. Would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a soft-sided carrier that can be conveniently stored.
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: Great for Travelling!
customer_reviews.text: I used this carrier to take my cat with me on a flight from the west coast to the east and he was very comfortable the whole time. The velcro on the bottom was very useful for keeping the carrier in place underneath the seat, especially during takeoff and landing. I used this carrier on a Southwest flight, and they charged me a $98 fee, which is normal for any carrier within their size restrictions. The pocket and shoulder strap were also invaluable to me while traveling. Overall, I'm very satisfied with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stefani T.

customer_reviews.title: Great pet carrier
customer_reviews.text: Great pet carrier. We used it to travel from New York to California with our cat, and it performed well. There is a Velcro strip on the bottom, that keeps it in place on the carpet of the airplane, so it was a little tricky getting it under the seat (especially when your teenaged kids are fighting over who gets the cat under their seat and try to position the carrier themselves). You jut have to be sure to keep it up off the floor while positioning it under the seat. I put my hand under the carrier and covered the Velcro strip until I had it where I wanted it.
customer_reviews.author: HowarthFam

customer_reviews.title: The leash attachment point inside is great. The bag was smaller than I expected based ...
customer_reviews.text: Convenient to carry over the shoulder. The leash attachment point inside is great. The bag was smaller than I expected based on the pictures and the video, but there isn't much one can do about the airline regulations. Good for brave social cats. Mine gets scared of the hustle and bustle outside and is happier, when I cover the windows. The bottom is slightly too soft for my cat and it bends, when my he is in. He doesn't appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Virpi Leppa

customer_reviews.title: Flying with your pet? These are perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these specifically to fly my cats in the cabin when I moved cross country. They fit perfectly under the seat and my (large) kitties had plenty of room. I’ve never seen carriers that unzip all the way around so that was an added challenge for sleep deprived me getting them ready for the airport, lol. I think these were very good quality and I really like them.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E. Hales

customer_reviews.title: My bratty cat actually likes this thing
customer_reviews.text: My cat hated her hard shell carrier so I expected her to hate this one but she hardly complains when I put her in it and barely cries when I walk around with her. I even caught her hanging out in it by her own volition. It folds flat which is nice, is light weight and seems to be made well. The shoulder strap makes it so easy to carry her. Highly recommend to anyone who usually goes with hard shell carriers to the dismay of their cat. By the way, she's 12 pounds, can't quite stand up fully but she can turn around easily and seems quite comfy.
customer_reviews.author: Jane

customer_reviews.title: He loved this carrier-- I got it about a month before ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this for traveling with my relatively large (~14lbs) cat on a plane. He loved this carrier-- I got it about a month before travel, and set it up for him to explore. He enjoyed sleeping in it occasionally. It was easy to travel with and fit great into the under-seat space. It also folds up flat for storage. My only complaint is that in order to stay folded up, there's a velcro closure which is located on the bottom of the carrier, with the scratchy side-- meaning, on a carpeted plane floor, the carrier velcros to the floor making it difficult to slide in and out from under the seat. Otherwise, very much cat-approved!
customer_reviews.author: InvaderRox

customer_reviews.title: Great Pet carrier!
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this carrier. It is a great color first off. It is sturdy and unzips to fold completely flat for storage. Nylon interior makes for easy cleaning. Lightly padded surface for pet to lay on, (i added a little mat for my cat.) Great carrier for the price! Has an inside tether strap if you have a pet that bolts. Only one problem. My cat has figured out how to unzip it from the inside. lol. We should have named him Houdini!
customer_reviews.author: D. Dolly

customer_reviews.title: The perfect size for my two Holland Lops!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this carrier! Just the perfect size for my two Holland Lops. I bought a little cushion to go in it but it turns out all I needed was a whelping pad and they're good-to-go!
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these when I moved my cats and I from Massachusetts to Oregon. They were perfect to fit under the airplane seat and have held up amazingly since I've bought them. They are also very convenient to store when not in use. One of my cats likes to play with the zippers and was able to get out once, so I just use those bread ties to tie the zipper together. However - I could not praise this product enough. Best cat carrier ever.
customer_reviews.author: kaila

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to store
customer_reviews.text: When I first got my cats I borrowed hard sided carriers and I didn’t like them. I bought these soft sided carriers for three cats ranging in weight from 4-6lbs, one for each of them, I love these carriers! They fold flat for storage, the are quick to assemble/disassemble, easy to get the cats in and out of and if needed I can carry all three at once because there is a handle and a shoulder strap. One of my cats has accidents every time she’s in the car and the carrier is easy to clean. They seem to like them better than the hard sided carrier too
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Convenient space saving carrier, but not good for all cats
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these carriers nearly two years ago, mainly due to their ability to collapse and save room. They have served me well up until today. I used one of them to take my boyfriend's cat to the vet, but when my boyfriend went to pick him up, they had the cat in a different carrier. Apparently his cat ripped a massive hole in it at some point after I dropped him off (couldn't have been in it for more than an hour; photo included). This carrier is great for cats that are relatively calm during transport, but if your cat is a scratcher or fighter, then I would recommend a hard sided carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca H

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier for air travel with a Cat.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this carrier for air travel with a 14 pound kitty and it worked great. A little bit small for her, but then again the space beneath the airline seat would not allow for a carrier any bigger. Was able to push down to get it to fit - a great soft side cat carrier. Will use this for trips to the vet. Only down side was that it is a little difficult to zip - the fabric is stretched tightly. Overall a great value and would recommend for purchase. Yes, would buy it again. Shoulder strap and outer pocket to hold papers or a leash are nice features!
customer_reviews.author: CityKitty

customer_reviews.title: Too small for a large cat.
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t buy it for airline travel. I bought it for trips to the bet. But it is too small for my 18 lb cat. It’s probably not the bag’s fault. I also didn’t like the zippered opening.
customer_reviews.author: NPE

customer_reviews.title: Great all-around carrier
customer_reviews.text: This is a great carrier. I love how it can zip up and collapse so easily. Plus, it was easy to buckle into the car. My new kitten came home in this carrier and slept in it for the first month at home. I usually put a fleece blanket or towel in the bottom. I also love that I can see my kitten very well while he is in the carrier, and he can see me! It definitely makes for a less stressful experience than a hard carrier.
customer_reviews.author: CLG

customer_reviews.title: tiny, lightweight, robust
customer_reviews.text: If you have a fairly normal-sized cat, it will fit in this, but not with much room to spare. It's quite reasonably robust. My cat made some very concerted attempts at getting out of it, with no great luck. It's lightweight and suitable for carrying a cat a few miles down the road to the vet. It's not designed for much more than that.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G. Hanlin

customer_reviews.title: but she can turn around and sit comfortably in this carrier
customer_reviews.text: This carrier is much nicer than I expected and fits my 18lb cat perfectly. There is not a lot of wiggle room, but she can turn around and sit comfortably in this carrier. We bought this to replace the old plastic create that she has had since kitten-hood. I love the multiple zippers, it allows you to access the animal through both ends of the carrier and it folds flat when not in use. If you are looking for a moderately priced carrier, I would highly recommend this piece.
customer_reviews.author: AshnOK

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for flying on an airline with a cat
customer_reviews.text: Fits under the airline seat great and meets all TSA standards. Love the leash attachment on the inside and the surrounding vents and added pocket. Easy to carry for long trips. My cat was very comfortable laying down and sitting up in it and she is medium sized (11 lbs). I used anti anxiety wipes all over the inside of the carrier and it held the odor well and was easy to clean after she peed in it (on a towel). No cushion or pad on the bottom though, that would be the only thing I might add to make this product even better.
customer_reviews.author: Siobhan

customer_reviews.title: If you have a snake or any animal I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this for a dog or cat it's for my snake. I chose this for my snake because of the full zipper design and how dark it is inside. I love how the zipper works effortlessly to prevent stress to my snake. It also zips up fully and prevents an escape route. This carrier is also very sturdy and very nice looking. The color was perfect and the crate itself is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Joni Munson

customer_reviews.title: The carrier is great however it is quite small
customer_reviews.text: I have to say some people's reviews were inaccurate. The carrier is great however it is quite small. I have one fat cat and one skinny cat. This only works for my skinny cat. I am worried about the many people who left reviews saying they were putting their large cats and medium sized dogs in this carrier. The poor animals must have been extremely cramped! Please only purchase this for very small animals. Nothing wrong with the carrier at all but make sure your pet will fit! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Got a VERY difficult kitty into and out of the carrier with minimum pain for either party.
customer_reviews.text: You can unzip this carrier as much as you need to, so makes it possible to get a very resistant kitty into it. Also when we got to the vet, it unzipped around her, then when we were ready to go, I just lifted the hand towel she was on and zipped the carrier back around her. Also easy to carry. Seems pretty well made, the price was great. One thing is, it is on the small side -- my medium-sized kitty was a pretty snug fit, so a large cat would need something a little bigger.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen F

customer_reviews.title: Durable carrier that is very easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The product is very well constructed. The materials are durable. My cat did claw at the screen window, but did not damage it at all. My cat is 10 pounds and this is a perfect size for her. For long car trips which we experience going to a warmer climate for part of the year, I would still use her hard sided roomier carrier. But for short trips, to Vet, to Groomer, this is perfect and much lighter weight. The shoulder strap is great. Storage is also great because it folds completely flat when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: N. Deston

customer_reviews.title: Two out of three ordered were great - the third had a production defect
customer_reviews.text: These would have gotten 5 stars in the two that did not contain a defect are great. Solid, sturdy carriers for vet visits. Unfortunately, the third (I ordered three - one for each cat) had a production defect. Part of the zipper was sown inside to you cannot close the carrier (defeats the purpose for vet visits). No receipt, so struggled on how to return. Decided to use the third as kitty den, so it's still getting use; not the use intended.
customer_reviews.author: robidana

customer_reviews.title: Not good for larger cats
customer_reviews.text: Only my 10 lb cat could fit in this without touching the sides. It’s a zipper close, so if your cat is a bolter, it’s not as easy to shut as your typical hardside carrier before your kitty escape artist makes a break for it. Plus, if the cat if large enough, I have to be wary of catcing their fur with the zipper. So far kitty has not been as calm in this carrier as a hardside carrier. Still, it has the advantges of being lighter, carry-on approved, and I like the shoulder strap for distributing the weight as I haul my furry friend around.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie F. Rutledge

customer_reviews.title: PUUUURFECT carrier bag!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag as I was traveling by plane with my two cats from Chicago to LA. My ten pound, medium stature cat fit perfect, with room to move around, and he was calm and cozy. I flew Southwest and there were no issues with the size of the carrier, which I was naturally worried about. It fit great under the seat. Very comfortable bag to carry as well! Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Locascio

customer_reviews.title: Ok for my cat’s needs
customer_reviews.text: Had a chemical smell at first, but I left it out for a few days, and it smells ok now. Folds all the way flat for storage. My cat is 15lbs. She fits fine, but the weight may be too much. My 20lb cat also fits. I wouldn’t trust the clips on the shoulder strap to hold him. I will use this carrier for my smaller cat on short trips to the vet. I think it would be great for pets under 10lbs.
customer_reviews.author: AJ Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier but a little too big for airlines (despite the title)
customer_reviews.text: Delta rejected the dimensions of this bag when I wanted to bring it on the plane, so even though it says "TSA approved" in the description, it is a little too big to bring on flights under your seat. Luckily the carrier was super nice otherwise and my mom ended up stealing it from me to use for her cats. It's very roomy and sturdy and the kitties liked it. Easy to get them in and out of, nice strap, great carrier all around. Just a little too big for flying!
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: GREAT, NICE
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 carriers from different manufacturers. I will keep both because I am very satisfied with both. However, both are "large" size but this one is a tiny bit smaller. My large cat is a little cramped in this one but I also have another cat who is a little smaller so it works out fine all the way around. Bottom line is I'm very satisfied with the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: TWICE RETIRED

customer_reviews.title: Only Carrier I've Needed to Buy!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this thing for over 2 years now and I love it. It's so easy to clean, store, and carry. Never have had any issues with the zipper and the shoulder strap is great. Our fire alarm always seems to go off a few times during the summer and we went down our 4 story apartment 5 times in 2 days, this made it easy to safely bring my cat with me. I'd totally pick this up if you are just looking for a simple carrier to transport your cat with :)
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Ritz

customer_reviews.title: Comfort even for a larger cat
customer_reviews.text: We love this for travel. Right now we have set them up around the house, thrown some catnip and toys and out of 3 cats 2 of them like the cosyness and a place to hide. LOL. We will see how they fair on a long flight coming up soon. We spoke to American Airlines. They have said the carrier is approved for their flights.
customer_reviews.author: SLM

customer_reviews.title: Chiropractors love hard animal carriers
customer_reviews.text: Hard plastic cat carriers are inexpensive, but a pain to carry a pet over 10 pounds and take up so much room! I can put my 6 month old cat in this carrier and the strap like a cross body purse and hold the carrier. It is soft, but firm enough for me to put the carrier in the seat and run the seatbelt through the top handle. He will have plenty of room as a full grown adult cat. Love this carrier.
customer_reviews.author: T. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Works for me
customer_reviews.text: Seems well made, was easy enough to zip up into shape, and it looks nice. The handles and strapping seem robust. I've only used it once, but it felt pretty solid. As to the purpose, it contained my cat just fine, though it wasn't the calming, life-changing experience that other reviewers had. He still cried and cried when the car began to move, but I can't blame the manufacturers for that. He doesn't try to claw his way back out, so I can't speak to durability on that front. I really like the tether clip on the inside, though I haven't used it yet. It's a nice option to have.
customer_reviews.author: Emily KTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, easy to clean but opens all the way
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this cat carrier, it was used for a multi day car trip and worked well, comfortable to carry, the only thing that was not so great is that it zips all the way open so if your cat/tiny dog push through they'll be able to completely open the entire carrier.... which isn't awesome, but once you get use to this feature or have an extra set of hands to help, then it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Good for Lufthansa! Sturdy and reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these: of for my 11lbs siamese and one of my 12lbs Yorkie. I used them to transport my cat from Europe to the U.S. and my dog on the same route, back and forth, about 3 times. While it can get uncomfortable to carry on your shoulder on the layovers while you're hurrying to catch the next flight, these are sturdy and do their job. If you can affix them on your carry-on, you will have no troubles. It's flexible and can fit most severe airline conditions for carry-ons pet containers. I used them with Lufthansa and it fits perfectly under the airplane chair.
customer_reviews.author: Flavia

customer_reviews.title: Two kittens fit comfortably. Eventually it will be only for one
customer_reviews.text: Two kittens fit comfortably. Eventually it will be only for one. They love this carrier because they can see outside from the front and 2 sides mesh windows. There is room in the back for them to hide. Convenient stretchy outside pocket fits cell phone and keys for walking with kitties. It's so comfortable for them to travel by car, that hey sleep comfortably on trips. Shoulder pad feature helps protect owner's shoulder.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Just OK not great!!
customer_reviews.text: This product is just Ok. I do not like the materials it is made from. It is rough and very hard feeling. The pad that is supposed to be on the inside of it is practically nonexistent. I really had to do a lot of feeling around to even find that something was there. The design also makes it a little awkward to carry. I will probably keep it but only because it is such a pain to return something, especially at Christmas time. The only thing I can say that I really like about it is the color.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: It works fine and folds up nice
customer_reviews.text: It works fine and folds up nice, although I have used it only once and my declawed cat was able to make two holes in the mesh in the front. I don't think he was trying to chew his way our, but I did hear him working hard on it with his paws. I would have to assume that is what caused the holes. And if that was the case, then I have to conclude that these are not very durable. I'm just wondering how quickly a cat with claws would get through the screen if he took the notion to?
customer_reviews.author: Mrhappyface

customer_reviews.title: excellent buy! Bought two and will be getting a third!
customer_reviews.text: This was my second purchase for two young kittens...bought one last year for my adult cat. I love this item and the price couldn't be better! I have yet to use them on an airplane, but I could see how they'd be perfect. Lightweight, convenient on your shoulder, and withstands two sets of angry kitten claws!
customer_reviews.author: PrettyLights

customer_reviews.title: My cat likes it!
customer_reviews.text: My 12 lbs cat fit comfortably for her trip to the vet. Only downfall was that she had an accident and it went straight through. It is sturdy though, and easy to carry, I’d suggest a blanket or towel for scared kitties. It was easy to wash off and hang to dry. Definitely a good purchase. My cat will even lay in it from time to time while it’s not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Suns7ar

customer_reviews.title: size "Large"
customer_reviews.text: This is much too small for a full sized cat. And I'm not talking about my 20lb orange tiger beast, I mean a regular average cat. It would fit a kitten, but even then the bottom of it is not stiff enough and sags, making it an even smaller carrier. So, I didn't even try it. The sides of it seemed sturdy enough but I'm not sure I would trust the mesh if you have a cat that just don't wanna be contained. In closing, I (as a certified crazy cat lady) am not down with this for space, comfort and safety of my fur babies.
customer_reviews.author: PaulaR.

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable for me and for my kitty
customer_reviews.text: My cat weighs 13 pounds and I found it unpleasant to carry her in her old hard carrier. I find it a lot easier to carry her with the shoulder strap in this soft carrier. And she seems happy to be in it. I left it open on the floor when I first got it and she crawled right in and went to sleep! This carrier is a big improvement for our trips to the vet.
customer_reviews.author: carolei

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice sturdy bag. I like the mesh siding that allows me to see my pet. It is a little to long lengthwise to fit under the seat. It had to be crammed in, in order to fit. It can fit widthwise, but then it is sticking out from under the seat and the stewardess says that it can't be that way because it blocks the other passengers from passing
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great carrier
customer_reviews.text: Great carrier. Others had said their cat actually liked being in this bag, which I didn't think was possible for ours because she normally goes ballistic and claws and bites her way out. However she is totally relaxed in here at the vet office and appears happy as a clam. I like that it folds up. It seems well made and sturdy for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ARK

customer_reviews.title: It fit snuggly between the seats but I feel like next time we fly I will have to get ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked for what I needed it for but it's quite small. My cat is 10lbs and not very high off the ground... but this thing was tight, even for her. It fit snuggly between the seats but I feel like next time we fly I will have to get something a little more roomy. The bottom has a velcro strap that allows the carrier to stay in place, but it got stuck to something mid flight and I was unable to pull it off the ground. Talk about sturdy. Overall, no serious issues... I just think it's too small for my cat.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: What is that smell
customer_reviews.text: First off this is really cute. That said, the chemical odor is overwhelming. If you need to use this immediately there may be a problem. This item needs to be sprayed and let air out. The chemical smell is strong. My can normally gets into the carrier with no issues. The smell must be a turn off for her. I will let this air out. Hopefully this will work. If not I may have to return Otherwise, being able to break this down to flat for storage is a plus.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cats won’t let me use them
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 for 2 cats. I used them once & they worked perfectly for getting my cats in the car for a trip across town. They hate car rides. But after that trip they would not allow me to put them back in these carriers. I’m sure they would bee fantastic if I could get my cats inside. They refuse to enter.
customer_reviews.author: QueenBee

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag. Nice price. Nice size for cat.
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these. Nice strap for over the shoulder. Pockets are nice. Mesh windows provide good air flow. Completely breaks down flat to hose off and clean up unfortunate mishaps (if your pet pukes in the car like mine does). Turquoise blue and orange colors were as shown. Nice bag for the money, when ya have multiples to tote.
customer_reviews.author: Informed Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Pleased so far
customer_reviews.text: In light of the issues we are currently having with delivery from UPS I am very impressed that this company reached out to confirm that I received my order! I did receive it in a timely fashion and with no damage. I haven’t used it yet but this carrier seems like just what we needed for our bearded dragon. It opens up completely for easy cleaning, the only thing I would add would be a soft washable pad so animals don’t slip around , this is easily resolved by adding in a towel or blanket. Letting it air out a bit due to the “new smell “ which is a chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Opens Too Easily
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent size for a midsize cat but unzips completely to collapse and is not lockable at any point. This makes it both difficult to get a cat into the carrier without it unzipping further, and difficult to keep a cat in the carrier if there is the slightest gap they can get into to open it up
customer_reviews.author: NATHANIEL

customer_reviews.title: Kitty hideouts
customer_reviews.text: I was afraid that a soft carrier would be flimsy, especially at this price, but I’m happy to report the carrier is sturdy enough for my 15 lb cat and easy to transport. I was surprised and happy to discover there is Velcro on the bottom of the carrier to keep it from sliding around in the car during transport. My cats love the carriers. We put them in the living room to explore before their first use so the cats could get used to them. After their vet visit, I put them back in the living room and the cats now use them as little hideouts.
customer_reviews.author: Moonpie

customer_reviews.title: On the small size but sturdy
customer_reviews.text: If you have a larger cat/dog this is not the carrier for you. That being said, I was able to fit a 9lb cat inside with a shirt for comfort. It has sturdy sides and bottom, offering good support when lifting the carrier with your pet inside. The sides are soft but stuff enough to stay in shape when moving the carrier about. It offers a lot of ‘window’ space so they can see out, but I would suggest covering the side ones if you have a spooky animal.
customer_reviews.author: Gared SparrowsonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase in a long time
customer_reviews.text: I was having such a hard time getting my cat in and out of a crate (he’s medium size about 11 lbs), but it’s so much easy to put him in here and he genuinely seems more comfortable since he isn’t sliding around or anything. I threw out the old crate and this will be my go to now.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this!
customer_reviews.text: We don't put our cat in a carrier very often, so I was glad I ordered this one! It folds down so that it doesn't take up a ton of space in the closet. The cat loves it and climbs in as soon as it gets zipped together. Those were the things I noticed the first few times we used it, but today I realized one of the best things. When it's all unzipped it lays flat, which really comes in handy when you have to clean cat puke out of it! I'm so glad I didn't have to wrestle a plastic carrier in the bathtub.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for an emergency evacuation carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have a 16lb cat and he was able to fit in here. Not much more room for movement but can lay down. With the cat there. It was sturdy while using both strap and handle to hold the carrier. My intention for this case was an emergency evacuation carrier as it should work great for that.
customer_reviews.author: JasonF

product_meta.title: Pet Magasin Airline Approved Cat Carrier - Water Resistant, Collapsible, Soft-Sided Kennel for Cats, Small Dogs, Puppies and Small Animal
feature_bullets: MAJOR AIRLINE CARRY-ON APPROVED: Product dimensions: 18" x 11" x 10", a perfect size for most cats, puppies and other small pets [do NOT fit Large dogs, please refer to measurement] works with all major airlines
SAFETY FIRST: Constructed to keep your pet safe; holds its shape when end panels are zipped up

LIGHT WEIGHT & FASHIONABLE DESIGN: Only 2.2 Pounds; and made with durable & luxurious material. Soft-sided pet carrier with comfortable padding inside, mesh window for ventilation, carry-handle and adjustable padded shoulder strap
EASY TO STORE & CLEAN: Folds flat for storage, and made from waterproof material so it's easy to clean
DURABLE & LONG-LASTING: Sturdy construction to keep your pet safe. Resistant to Animal bites. Exterior are made from waterproof material so it's easy to clean.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
